testimony: Thank you Chairperson.  Chairperson, we have a problem now for the proceedings to carry on because one of the applicants, Mr Michael Armoed, who is in prison has not yet been brought to the hearing by the South African Police, Boksburg.
Yes.  Is there any reason why he's not here?  I gather that on Friday he was taken back to the Johannesburg Prison?
Yes Chairperson, when we enquired from the police they said they took him back to Johannesburg Prison on Friday because the original arrangement was that they are going to keep him until Friday.
That is despite the announcement that was made by this Committee that the matter will proceed today?

It looks like despite that announcement, Chairperson yes, but be that as it may we have made some arrangements with them now to go and fetch him as soon as possible from Johannesburg and bring him here.
Yes, what time did they leave?
I think they left at about nine a.m. because that arrangement was made with them, at about nine or some few minutes after nine.
Thank you Mr Chairman.  Mr Chairman I'm of the opinion on behalf of the applicants that it is desirable that the applicants be present throughout the hearing.
We're talking about one applicant here not applicants.
Mr Armoed to be present during the hearing especially when there's evidence being led against him from the witness who is now testifying.
Chairperson if Mr Madasa feels strongly about the point I won't be able, Chairperson, to object to his sentiment.

I think it is desirable that when evidence is led against an applicant he should be present so that he can hear what the witnesses have to say often concerning his role in any activity in which he is implicated.  However I think it is highly undesirable that this committee should be having constant problem with the applicant being brought to these hearings, I cannot understand why the applicant could not have been here at about half past nine.  Now do I understand why the applicant had to be taken back to prison when an announcement was made by this Committee that these proceedings will continue today?  Mr Mapoma would you please take the matter up with the Station Commander and find out precisely why is it that the applicant was taken back to Johannesburg Prison when we had indicated that these proceedings will continue today?
Well in the circumstances we will have to wait until Mr Armoed arrives at which stage we will then continue with the evidence of Mr Lekabe.

Very well we will rise and reconvene as soon as the applicant is here.
COMMITTEE ADJOURNS
ON RESUMPTION

Notwithstanding the assurances that we were given earlier on, that the police had left at approximately 9 o'clock to go and fetch the first applicant, it would appear that the police only left for Johannesburg at approximately half past ten and I gather that there would be some delay before they return with the applicant.
	It seems to us that in the interest of progress these proceedings should continue and what will happen is that when the first applicant comes to join the proceedings, Mr Madasa, who represents all the applicants, will be able to tell the applicant what evidence, if any, had been led against him and thereafter take instructions from the first applicant so as to dispute 
whatever piece of evidence he might want to dispute from this witness.  If the witness has already stood down by that time, the witness will be recalled to whenever Mr Madasa to put those questions to the witness.  We are of the view therefore that the proceedings ought to proceed.  Yes Mr Madasa, you were still busy cross-examining the witness.  Mr Lekabe may I remind you that you are still under oath?

Yes Mr Madasa would you please proceed with your cross-examination?
CROSS-EXAMINATION BY MR MADASA

Thank you Mr Chairman.
	You remember when I asked you about the stayaway you agreed that you disagreed with Manyala about the stayaway?
Would that be the - what was the date of the stayaway?  Was any date given to that?  I think I said August.
Chairperson, I don't remember the date but I remember that we had a dispute about the stayaway.
Is it correct that the stayaway was called so that a March could be organised for the release of ANC Youth League Members who were arrested.
So Manyala was organising a march for the release of your own members, is that correct?
Is it correct that in the ANC Youth League you, at Mololeke, you were the ringleaders so to speak of that Youth League?
I want you to clarify your question, sir.
Were you the most influential leader within the ANC Youth League at Mololeke?
Now you agreed that you worked together with the SDU, you wanted them to teach you discipline.  Now my question is how long did you remain part of the SDU?
Chairperson, I don't remember the duration of relationship up to a point where we had a dispute.
On Friday you also told us that you separated with them because they were involved in killings, remember that?
What were the other reasons that caused the ANC Youth League and the SDU to have disagreement besides the killings?

As you've put this question now, I have documents which verified people who were taking sides in Mololeke.  They were taken by members of SDU and they were given to their friends.  I hope that if this Commission will allow me, I would pass over these documents.
Now, is it correct that you had problems with the fact that the SDU members were not, so to speak, born and bred in the Township?
Will you please clarify your question?
Did you not have a problem with the fact that the SDU members were people who came from the rural areas?
No chairperson it's not like that.
The applicants say you did not like them for that reason and other reasons of course.
As I've already explained that what they're saying is a lie.
Do you know that the SDU had a flag that was made by the Civic as a symbol of their recognition at Mololeke.  Do you know that?
No chairperson, I don't know that.
Did you have a flag that was made by the Civic?
May you please explain your question, what do you mean, who was the flag belonging to, ANC Youth League or SDU?
Yes we had an ANC Youth League flag.
After you had separated with the SDU did you assume a new name?
Did you form a new SDU or you patrolled as Youth League?

As I've already explained Chairperson, that Mololeke Community raised concerns about what is happening. Members of the SDU were supposed to put down their arms up to the point where the correct SDU unit has been formed.
My question is did you formerly form a new SDU which was known as an SDU?
No Chairperson, we didn't form a new SDU.
You know that the ANC made a call for the formation of SDU's is that correct?
Was there a call made for the ANC Youth League to defend the community?
Yes the ANC Youth League was part of the community, they were able to form an SDU.
But your organisation as Youth League was only comprised of ANC members, is that correct?
And the ANC call was that the SDU should be non-partisan, are you aware of that?
That is the area where I'm aware that is why I said as part of the Civic all organisations reported to the civic.

Let's talk about the attack at Blanko, Blanko's house.  Is it correct that on the 6th December you, that is ANC Youth League members, you all came together at the spot where you usually met?  Is that correct?
That is correct I said even other members of the community were present.
Who were those members of the community.
Those who came from Block A, other came from Block B, others came from Block C.
But the meeting was for ANC Youth League members.  Is that not so?
There was no meeting as such.
Are you saying you did not meet on the 6th December?
As I've already said that we met where we were supposed to meet yes, we met but it was not a meeting.  It was not to respond to the call about the death of Bulelwa.
May I request you to speak a little bit softly please and a little bit slow.
But there's no translation what's the problem?
There was translation, can I repeat?
As I say chairperson, it was not a meeting, a formal meeting, it was because of the call, we met because of the call of Bulelwa's death.  She was already dead by then.
At that meeting you then planned to attack the SDU members, is that correct?
It is not about the attack, it was to apprehend them and bring them to the community.
Did you bring Blanko to the community?
We did not because he resisted the apprehension.
But on Friday when you testified you said you found Blanko asleep after...don't rush.
And the day after attacked him, you did not speak of trying to apprehend him?

Chairperson, maybe I did not explain that -but the way it is we were tired about what was done by members of the SDU's.  I explained that we started from other places which belonged to SDU members then we proceeded to Blanko's house then we found him asleep.
Did you kill him whilst he was asleep?
No he was awake but at the time he was resistant that he should come with us.
Did you ask him to come with you?
Did you ask him to come with you?
Yes we told him that we are tired about what they're doing within the community.
When you went to Blanko's place where were you from?
We were from - we started from where we met at Block C.
So from Block C you went to Blanko's place?
We started from other houses which belonged to SDU's then we did not find them.
The first house is Vusi's place.  We were a group, the others went to other places so I don't know where they went to.
Did you go to Manyala's place - Block D?
I don't remember well as I said that we were in groups.
In the group in which you were did you proceed from C straight to Blanko?

Before we went to Blanko's place and then we passed - proceeded - then we missed him.  After that he spent a long time - maybe he was going to call others - so we tried to apprehend those who we think who were inside the community.
After you had seen Bulelwa's body did Buthelezi tell you to go and attack the SDU members?
As I've explained in the beginning, Chairperson, Buthelezi came to my place crying, he was not present there, he went back.
Are you saying that Mr Buthelezi was not present at the meeting that where the [indistinct] from blocks A, B, C had gathered?
Now we've heard that some of the members had removed items at Blanko's place?
I heard from the first time from members of the SDU's.  Even in the morning when they apprehended me they didn't show me what has been taken.
Now during that time in '93 were you working?
I was working temporarily but at that time I had been retrenched.
How old were you that time?
Were there other members of ANC Youth League working seeing that they were around 14, 16 years old?
I would have thought if they were 14 they would be at school?
I don't remember if there were some members of the Youth League who were working.  The majority of them were students.
Chairperson, they were not going to school because of the situation at that time.
It is said that some of your members owned shacks, is that correct?
They were not their own shacks, those were the hiding places when they were harassed by the Stability Unit because the Stability Unit would come at any time so those were their hiding places.
So your members had shacks where they would hide?
I don't know how many there were because we were many.
Would they spend most of their time at those shacks or at their homes?

Much of the time they'd spend at their homes, they'd go to those shacks when they expect
the Stability Unit would come.
Now you said after you were apprehended by the SDU members, did you say Oscar - Oscar tried to shoot you, or Armoed?
He tried to shoot you in the presence of the people?
It was in the morning, I think it was before 6 o'clock or after 5 o'clock in the morning.  There was a certain lady who came out and she was chased away.
Why did Armoed try to shoot you?  Where were you?
As I have already explained, I was in front of him because one of them started to shoot with 765 rifle, he tried three times until the magazine went out.
You said on Friday he tried to shoot you when you were at the people where the people had converged?
I said it's Oscar who tried to shoot me where we were where people were around or present.
Now it's correct that Oscar was part of the group which went to fetch you?
And he had an opportunity to shoot you there if he wanted to, is that not so?  If he wanted to shoot you he would have shot at you when he apprehended you?
When they came as a group, I've already explained, Oscar himself, we did have a discussion both of us because people who were with him were not able to see me.  He's the one who called me.
Did you say that yourself and Oscar had a discussion?
That is the time when he asked me why did we say he's the one who has killed Bulelwa.
Then they went with me and then we were going along the township trying to take other members of the ANC Youth League.
Was he referring to the conversation with Oscar?  Did he ask you why you were alleging that he had killed Bulelwa, is that right?
I don't know Chairperson why did he say we alleged that he has killed Bulelwa.
But did he say that?  Did he say that you guys were saying that he's the one who killed Bulelwa?
When they apprehended me, as I've already explained, that he called me - then he said why did we allege that he has killed Bulelwa.  Because I was scared I told him who said he [inaudible] Bulelwa.
You asked him who had made that allegation?
Yes I did.  He replied that there are people who have been apprehended then they say I am myself, myself I'm responsible for that allegation.
Now you said you escaped by pretending as if you were going to call for help, did you say that?
The applicants say they brought you to the community in order to account about Blanko's death?

I do not remember the reason for them to take me to the community.  What I remember is that they told me that I was supposed to appear before the community to be responsible for everything that happened.

Well I suppose that what is being put to you is that the applicant's say that you were supposed to appear before the community which had gathered there and to account for the deeds of the Youth League.  Is that what you're putting to him?
I don't quite understand.  Why does he say the Youth League activities.
Well possibly because the Youth League had killed Blanko amongst other things, that they were alleged to have done then.
I was taken before the community to account but that was not the case.  I was first taken to the shack to speak to those who had kept shack and I could not even speak to the community at the end.
What were you supposed to say to those who were the shack?
I was enquiring about the allegations that I mentioned that Oscar killed Bulelwa.
Then you say you were never taken into the community?
I did not account before the community because at that time I was among the members of the SDU.

But what is being put to you is not that you accounted before the community, what is being put to you is that you were required to appear before the community and to account before the community and presumably for the activities of the Youth League including the death of Blanko.  We all know that you didn't do that because you went away but the applicants say that was their purpose.  It was to bring you to the community and get you to account before the community.  Do you understand the question?

Well if you listen carefully, you'll understand the question.  What is being put to you is that the applicants say that what they had in mind with you was that you will appear before the community which had gathered there and then account for the conduct, or the activities if you will, of the Youth League members which of course included the killing of Blanko.  Do you understand that?  That's what they wanted to do with you.  What do you say to that?

Is it correct that at that time amongst the organisations there was an understanding that if a leader of an organisation was involved in some acts like acts of killing, the leader would not be killed but would be brought before the community to account?
It's the leader or if the members of the organisation?

If a leader of an organisation, Mr Chair, was involved in killing for example, the understanding at the time was that such person would be brought before the community before any action is taken against him.  Is that not so?
But you did not do so with Blanko because he resisted, is that so?

That is correct, I have explained already that they were armed themselves.  Now we wanted those who were armed first, we wanted Blanko to tell us who were those among them where I am sure that we can first get hold of the arms.
Is it correct that at the scene where the community had gathered you were free to move around, you were not tied for example, is that correct?
Then I'm putting to you that you escaped from that scene because you were running away to account to the community about Blanko's death and other activities?
He was running away to account or was he running away in order to avoid accounting to the community?
I should say to avoid, Mr Chairman.   You ran away to avoid to account to the community?
I explained already that they tried at the time they were rounding us up, they were armed and they were very angry so their anger went a little bit down because at that time I did not run away.
When you went to Blanko to attack him were you not armed?   Were you not armed?
We were armed but members of the community were armed, among members of the Youth League were not armed.
Were you?  I'm referring to you now, were you not armed.
And when you went to Blanko you believed, at that time, you believed that Blanko and his colleagues had killed Bulelwa and were armed?  Is that not so?
I was the leader, I was not supposed to carry any weapon.
Did you not anticipate an attack from Blanko's place?

We did not anticipate an attack, I already explained that some members of the community clearly indicated that they were tired.  They said they were arming because those guys might be also in a spirit of war.
You deny that the ANC Youth League members were involved in criminal activities?

Now in my possession here I have the Mololeke Police docket and inside it there's a statement by one France Towu who worked for a paraffin company and in that statement, which is A5, he states that around June/July they were attacked by the members, they were hijacked by the members of the ANC Youth League and after these members had died as a result of the massacre he went there to identify them and he indeed he identified some of those people.  What do you say to that?  Do you know anything about what Mr Towu says?
Chairperson it's my first time to hear that.

And also in the docket Mr Towu's colleague, somebody who worked with him, I think it's ...[inaudible] out of the last I take, on the 1st December 1993, by the Youth Members and he also identified some of them amongst the deceased.

I said earlier on I do not know of such an incident.  What I know is that there were problems because of the situation that reigned in Katlehong.  Some youth would leave their areas and go and cause trouble in the other area.  I do not know as to whether he knew some of those members, it's the first time to hear of that.
And lastly on Towu, they say he and ...[indistinct] they say your members were armed with not only AK-47's but other assortment of arms like pump action pistols.  Do you know anything about that?
Chairperson I have already explained that I never received that kind of a report, it's my first here to hear of this incident.

A  certain Mr Moodley who was in the management of that paraffin company - he also states that he told his employees, workers, to pay an amount varying from R50 to R70 to your members in order to secure entry to Mololeke section to do deliveries?
It's not the first time to hear of that protection fee but as the leaders we condemned that move, we said anyone must feel free to come to the township - no protection fee at all was required.
Now you've just conceded that some of your members caused trouble but in other areas, what kind of trouble did they cause in those areas?

Chairperson, Mololeke it's a section in Katlehong so you will never stop someone to go somewhere else.  To be in a position to talk to such a person and call him to order you'll have to first contact his leaders where he comes from.
Yes I hear the explanation, my question is - you have said some of your members caused trouble in other areas.  Do you know what kind of trouble did they cause?
I do not know the troubles they caused.
Were you told about the trouble they caused?
But you know that they caused trouble?

I am explaining that some of the youth would leave from where they stay.  The easiest way to identify them and to know their organisation would be to catch them, ask them who their leaders are, then you'll be in a position to know that they have caused trouble.
Well, what exactly were you told did your members do in these other areas?
No sir, I was not told of my members who caused trouble.
Well you mentioned that you were told that you did receive a report that some of the members of the Youth League had gone to some other areas and caused trouble.

That was a report received by Central in other words where all members of the Youth League come together.  I did not personally receive a report at Mololeke that members of the Youth League in Mololeke did this and that.
What is it that the report said had been done by these members of the Youth League?
The report was related to the criminal activity that took part in some of the areas in Katlehong not specifically Mololeke.
So in other words, the report alleged that some of the members of the Youth League had been engaged in some criminal activities in other parts of Katlehong?

Now you said earlier on that you were not on good terms with the members of the SDU?  Did you say that?  You as a person now, I'm not referring to the ANC Youth League. You personally you were not on good terms with the SDU members?  Is that correct?
Those people I was not on good terms with were the top ones, I'm referring now to the committee of the SDU.
The top structure from Central to Zonal to?
Not from Central I'm referring to Leleke where I resided at that time.
I assume the leadership of the SDU at Mololeke?

The problem was that when you tried to interpret the politics of that day some of them would say to you - listen here we are here to work and if someone is not co-operating we'll use the powers that we have.  Let me provide an example - there is a day where I tried to sit down with the leadership of the SDU in the section, you know, to iron out the problems that the community encountered.  Now that meeting did not take place because they were threatening the members of the Civic, they said we were then no better.
Was Manyala part of that leadership which you disagreed with at Leleke?  Was Leleke leadership Manyala?
Manyala was in the zonal section, he also resided in Mololeke.
You also did not like him?
Our conflict started with that issue of the stayaway.
But he was trying to help your members to be released?
If you are a leader you must know the reasons for the stayaway, you don't just wake up in the morning and hear people being stopped from work.
Alright, so you disagreed with any activity wherein you were not conducted or consulted before?
Yes that is correct because as the leaders of Mololeke, we were supposed to account before the central and the zonal.
Alright, now do you remember what you said earlier on on Friday - that you worked together with SDU but for a short moment, you remember saying that?
What month is it you came together with the SDU?
Chairperson, so many things happened in Mololeke.  I do not remember the month very well
Now do you know Tulani and Maya?
Because the witness earlier on on Friday testified about a certain Tulani who was apparently a member of the Executive Committee.  Is that right?
He was a member of the ANC Youth League?
Tulani says in his statement in the docket that before June, June/July '93 you were working together with the SDU.  Do you confirm that?
And then after June/July you still remained working together but you agreed on different times of patrol, that is you would patrol during the day and the SDU at night?
It was during the start of the conflict.
And you agree that after June/July you then agreed to patrol different times?
I do not understand your question.  What do you mean when you say we agreed that we will patrol in different times?

Mr Lekabe the Advocate is asking you this, you had a problem with the SDU but between the two of you were some arguments that your group will patrol at a certain time and the SDU will patrol at a certain time?
My lord I'm explaining that it was already during the conflicts between the ANC Youth League and the SDU.
The question still remains did you agree?
Now, Oscar Motlokwa denies that he tried to shoot at Zulu as you testified - Zulu - remember you said Oscar tried to shoot Zulu?
He is just denying it.  Ali Zulu is the first person he shot at in Block A.
Is that a person that he shot at four times?
I explained that he shot him at the chest six times.
And what happened to him?  Did he die there?
We left him lying there in Block A.
Yes he was already dead when we left him.
Now you remember you said there were members of the community who were armed when you went to Blanko.  Who were those people who were armed?
I explained already that members of the community were present but I did not specifically look at them.  They were there though.
So you don't know their identity?
I do not know their identity.
How were they armed, what did they carry?
Some had guns, some had different assortment of weapons.
Do you know from which area they came from in Mololeke?
They came from Block A, I explained already, Block A, Block B, Block C.
But you did not know them?
Yes, I do not know them.
Who burned the place of Blanko?
I do not know because after the shootout I left, I don't know those who left behind among them who burned the house.
Do you perceive yourself as guilty of the killing of Blanko?
Can you please elaborate your question?
Do you think you were involved in the killing of Blanko?
I do not think I have a contribution - I do have a contribution towards his death.
Mr Madasa, is this relevant to the question whether or not there is full disclosure by the applicants or whether what the applicants did, did with political motivation?
Mr Chair, I'm testing his credibility.

Testing his credibility by what he admits he was part of the gathering of people that decided to go and round up the persons who were believed to be armed and that he was part of a group of Youth League members and some members of the community that went to Blanko's place but he was not armed, he has told us, nor were any members of the Youth League armed.  That's what he says.
But Mr Chair he has not told us what he did there.
He is not applying for Amnesty.
I know Mr Chair.  Should I withdraw the question?  I just want to find out from him.
What is the relevance of that to the issues that are before us?  He is not applying for amnesty or is it being alleged by the applicant that he did something?
It is alleged that he was seen by Oscar at Blanko, he is one of the people who killed Blanko.

Thank you Mr Chair.  Oscar Motlokwa, when he gave evidence, he said as a neighbour of Blanko, he saw you there, you are one of the people who killed Blanko.  What do you say to that?  Is that true or false, short answer, is that true or false?
But you have just denied involvement?
Where did I refuse my involvement because your question was did I think, your question was "do you think" and I don't think - I am certain that I had a contribution.

Mr Madasa correctly then Oscar gave evidence that he indeed saw ...[indistinct] at the meeting.  I think he also referred to him carrying a weapon at the time but he did not say that he saw him shooting or killing Blanko.  Is there really a relevance which could take it further by us establishing whether he did shoot at Blanko or not?
Thank you Mr Committee Member, Oscar says...[intervention]
Just before you get to that, Oscar alleges that he saw you at Blanko's place and that you were carrying an AK-47, what do you say to that?
He saw me shooting, I did not have a gun when we arrived, I took that gun from one of the members of the community.
So at Blanko's place you were present and you had an AK-47?
I did not carry an AK-47 but when I shot, I took it from one member of the community, I shot and then I returned it.

Thank you Mr Chairman.  Mr Chair I have no further questions.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MADASA
Mr Mapoma do you have any questions?

Yes Chairperson, one or two.
	When you disagreed with Manyala's march against the release of the ANC Youth League members you had no mandate from the community?
Did you have a mandate from the ANC Youth League?
Elaborate your question, which mandate are you referring to the mandate for the march or?
It's the mandate for the march, did Manyala have the mandate from the ANC Youth League now for the march?
That is not correct because people did not expect that march.
Thank you Mr Mapoma.  Mr Sibanyoni do you have any questions?

Yes, thank you Mr Chairperson.
	Mr Lekabe, let me begin at the end of your evidence, you said you took the AK-47 from one member, you shot and you returned it back, if I understand you correctly?
Let us go a little bit backwards.  You said Oscar killed Ali Zulu, that he was the first person he killed?

Right, let me just try to find out from you.  These applicants when they come here to apply for amnesty they talk about everything they did, in other words they disclose everything they did.  Now I'm saying to you if really he killed Ali Zulu, he would mention him as well?  What do you say about that?
On Friday I said that what they are saying here it's a pure lie.
When you left at the meeting remember when you said you are asking for transport, you want to go and find assistance and then that's how you escaped?
At that stage you realised that the tension was bad at Mololeke because you are saying these were armed and they've captured some of the members of the ANC Youth League?
If you could just not move too close to the mike please.  Now why didn't you at that stage go and report to the either the ISU or to the police realising the seriousness of the situation?

I think I have alluded to the fact that the situation in Katlehong was to such an extent that co-operation was not possible between the police and the community so it was my duty to inform the bigger organisation which is SANCO or rather the Civic.
In other words you wouldn't at any stage go and appeal for assistance to the ISU?
That is correct, I would never dare do that because we did not trust them.

So that also from the statements of the relatives of the victims specifically to a statement by a mother to ...[indistinct] mother who says that after they heard about the death of their children, they went to the peace committee.  Was the peace committee the only institutional place where you would go for assistance?

I do not understand why they went to the Peace Committee because I think at that time the Peace Committee was tasked with the investigation into the police activities.  Maybe they did not have the knowledge of where to go.

And you also said that the youths were staying with their parents but at some times they would go to stay at the shacks when they suspect that the ISU would attack them - they went to the shacks to hide, do you remember saying that?
Why would the Stability Unit attack the - or - yes we use the word attack - why would the Internal Stability Unit attack the youth?

I was the leader in the Civic and when things happened I was supposed to be there and witness.  If I remember well, I tried to intervene and I was talking to the members of the Internal Stability Unit and they responded by saying they were looking for criminals in Mololeke.  Now for them, every young man is a criminal, they don't choose, that is why the youth ran away from the Stability Unit.
So do I understand you well that the ISU suspected your members as part of the criminals or as criminals.
Let's go to the time when Blanko was killed.  I heard you saying members of the community were also present?
A rough estimation, how many members of the community were there?
I know that an estimation is not a precise thing, it might have been seventy if not eighty.
Now when these youth members of your Youth League were captured by the SDU do you know why members of the community didn't intervene and tried to stop that or help them out with that capture?
I know the reason why sir.
Can you tell us the reason?
It's because of the fear.  They feared members of the SDU so much because even on that day they were going to be harassed if ever they raised their objections.
You are saying it is alleged that you are the person who alleged that Oscar killed Bulelwa.  My question is did you make that allegation, did you suspect Oscar for killing Bulelwa?
No sir I explained already that Bulelwa was killed already Monday night and I knew that Oscar had just been released from prison on Thursday.
Were the police aware of the differences, or as you call, it the conflict between the SDU and the ANC Youth League?  Were the police aware of that conflict?
We were not co-operative with the police, the central committee of the SDU or the central committee of the Civic was supposed to intervene at that time not the police.

My question is - but were the police aware that you were not in good terms, that at Mololeke the SDU's and the Youth League are not in good terms, they are either fighting over control of the area or anything of that sort.  Are they aware of that?
I do not have knowledge to that effect.

Oscar and the other applicants told this Committee that Bulelwa was supportive of the SDU's, or let me call them the old SDU's, that even in a meeting where discussions were held towards the commission of new SDU's, Bulelwa questioned the reason for formation of the new SDU when there was an SDU in existence.  Do you agree with that?
You are saying Bulelwa was not supportive of the SDU's and also she didn't object to what the formation of the new SDU?
Thank you Mr Chairperson, no further questions.  Or Mr Chairperson, if I can just put one last question?

Mr Lekabe, you said when you were talking to the SDU's I heard you saying there was no agreement as a result.  Somebody said we should rather fight with you because you do not want to understand.  Who said that?
On Friday I said Ntneba and Ntjebe don't know were present in that meeting.
But who attached that statements that it seems you do not want to work with us we'd rather fight?
I do not know who killed Bulelwa.  I explained already that I was fetched - Bulelwa was already dead.
Why did you go to Blanko's place if you didn't know who killed Bulelwa?
On Friday I mentioned in my talk that there was an allegation to the effect that prominent leaders were going to be attacked and Bulelwa's death was the first attack.

What was - you've been saying the relationship between and the SDU's was not one as they have tried to picture, but why would they have first attacked her?  Why would they not have gone for yourself or for Vips or one of the other Youth League members?
I would not have knowledge why they started with her.  There was an organisation called Train Sector then, I think the conflict started at the Train I won't know exactly.
Was there more of a conflict between the Civic and the SDU than there was between the Youth League and the SDU?
Was the conflict with the Civic and not with the Youth League?  Am I hearing you correctly?
Yes that is correct, the conflict was between the Civic and the SDU not the Civic and the Youth League.
There was also conflict between the Youth League and the SDU?
Who was the number one enemy of the SDU?  The Civic or the Youth League?
The enemy number one was the Civic and members of the Youth League were the secondary enemy.
Why did you say that Bulelwa did not have a good relationship with the SDU?

Some of the things they mentioned here are incorrect.  When the issues regarding the SDU were deliberated on, women were excluded because the allegation is that Bulelwa was threatened in that meeting when she questioned the formation of the new SDU.
Were you present at that meeting?
Why would you have knowledge of what happened there?
I was the Secretary General for the Mololeke Section.  Everything that happened came to me so that I can note them down for further references, for instance reporting to bigger meetings.
Are you saying that if indeed she was told not to speak that that would have been reported to you?
As members of the Civic we played a bigger part and we were supposed to keep an eye so that conflicts do not erupt in the township so everybody had a freedom of speech.
I have no further questions thank you.

Thank you Chairperson.
	Mr Lekabe, within the Youth League did you have a member by the name of Nomfundo?
Did you have ladies in the Youth League, that is the Executive?
Were there many within the Executive?
I understand you to say that Ali Zulu was killed and you know the persons who killed him.  Ali Zulu - am I right?
And because you were not in good terms with the Stability Unit or the Police you are not desirous that the killers of Ali Zulu should be apprehended and should be answerable for such killing?
I told you already that I based my trust on my leaders to resolve this issue.
How do you hope your leaders would have resolved the killing of Ali Zulu because this is a criminal act?

We were trying, as the members of the Civic, to curb the conflicts between the community and I believe that members of the Katlehong ANC branch would have had a contribution.  They would call members of the SDU and warn them because we had reported to them on several occasions that these people were troubling us.

Let's just return to your capturing and you being threatened by Mr Oscar Motlokwa that he wanted to shoot you.  You said there is a Mr Mokoena who prevented him.  Who is this Mr Mokoena who prevented Mr Motlokwa, Oscar Motlokwa from shooting you?

He was one member of Block F.  At that time Block F was reporting to the section committee of the Civic.   Mololeke, as I mentioned earlier on, was divided into smaller sections.  Mokoena himself was one of the people who was wanted by the SDU.
Now when this Mr Mokoena prevented Mr Oscar Motlokwa from shooting you, where were you, were you at Block F where the corpse of Bulelwa was lying?

Would I be reading the situation right if I say or that when Oscar tried to kill you by shooting and he was prevented from so doing, your life was safe there because it was no longer endangered because the community was aware of that?
The community was aware of what sir, can you explain?
Let me do it this way - when you got to Block F were there people there where the body of Bulelwa was lying?
Ten, fifteen, twenty, what number could you give to that - it's an estimation so don't think I want a precise number?
About fifteen if not more, I did not count them.
And within these fifteen people was Mr Mokoena one of them?
What I'm saying to you, was your life not safe now because you are with the community and one member has already been stopped from attempting to shoot you?
I do not understand what you mean sir if you say I was now safe?
What I'm saying is that your life wasn't threatened any more because Oscar who attempted to shoot you was prevented from doing so?
I don't know whether will I be making a mistake, if a person tries to shoot you and he is stopped, won't he try to do it some other time?
I mean for the day, now I was saying for that day at least you were safe.
I was not that safe because he could have been shot at also.
Could you tell us when Buthelezi, Mr Buthelezi came to report to you that Ms Bulelwa has been killed.  Roughly what time of the day was it when he came to you?
It was five or ten minutes after eight o'clock at night.
And what time did you people with the community, that is the ANC Youth League and the community, attack Blanko?
It was about three o'clock in the morning.
Where did you or when did you now round up the community to make them aware about the death of Bulelwa for instance?
They responded to the whistle, sir.  I think many of them came because of Mr Buthelezi's cry.  Prior to his crying there was a whistle.

We are made to understand that, that when there is trouble, there would be the whistle and the applicants are saying that they responded to a whistle and went where the trouble was in other words where Bulelwa's body was.  Would that happen in that fashion?
Was there any whistle blown to alert the community that something has happened on this particular day, that is the night of the 6th December 1993?
Yes a whistle blew - I think I explained that people gathered after Mr Buthelezi came to report to me that Bulelwa has died.
They gathered at Block C, there was a Sparza shop in the township where they gathered.  They came to me because of Mr Buthelezi's cry.
Are you suggesting that when Mr Buthelezi came to you he blew or alerted the community whilst being at your place?
A whistle blew then Mr Buthelezi came crying to me.  Now I think the blowing of the whistle and his cry, the two have a certain meaning.
No, no, I want to say the whistle which was blown, was it blown at Block F or was it blown at Block C?
I do not remember well where the whistle blew, but it was blown.
Let's take it that when the community gathered at the place you're saying - Block C - you obviously advised them that the whistle is blown because Bulelwa has been killed?
I think they gathered because of Mr Buthelezi's cry and he explained Bulelwa's death.
And you did not lead the community to go and verify at Block F about the certainty of Bulelwa's death?  You accepted that she was dead and you would act with the community?

On Friday I explained that I tried to go alone with Mr Buthelezi and members of the community said to me listen, you know you've not been on good terms with these people, now they're going to get hold of you and then they are going to assault you.  I think I explained that on Friday.
Did you then without you saying to the community go and see at Block F where the body of Bulelwa is lying?  You did not do that did you?
I did not do that sir.
Did Buthelezi at your place stay until the community gathered?
He stayed a few minutes while the community was gathering.
Did he explain to the community that I'm here because Bulelwa has been killed?
I am explaining the community gathered because of his cry.  They heard from him when I tried to calm him down - I said please come down so that we can understand each other.
How much time did Mr Buthelezi spend on your place when he was hysterical?
I would not be sure because I did not have my watch.  It might have been twenty or less than twenty minutes.

When the community gathered could you give us an indication how many people or how many members of the community gathered at Block C where you were present and Mr Buthelezi telling them that Bulelwa has died?
We did not gather at my home we gathered at a Sparza shop.  It could have been forty to fifty members of the community.
And Mr Buthelezi had not said who killed Bulelwa?
He had not explained yet who killed Bulelwa.
Whilst gathered at this tuck shop or Sparza shop you deliberated with the community what next to do, isn't it so?
The community pronounced it's dissatisfaction - they said enough is enough.  I did not address them.

I want to understand, Mr Lekabe, that at that stage nobody knew who killed Bulelwa.  How did you arrive at the decision that you should now round up the members of the SDU and start with the top structure, probably Blanko.  How did you arrive because you had no knowledge who killed Bulelwa?

Chairperson I explained already that the community was dissatisfied of the activities of the SDU in Mololeke, they took a decision that enough was enough, they were not going to wait for yet another incident.
Mr Lekabe, is it not the understanding that when the SDU's were formed you were protecting largely the community of Katlehong against Inkatha.  Is my understanding correct this far?
It was not against Inkatha as such, it was against any attack that would take place any time.
Yes, you're correct and the other attacks would be acts of criminality against the community?
To give an example, let's say there's a hit car who would be responsible for such attacks.

Yes, now what I'm merely saying, let me be open to you is that whilst I said I want an understanding, my understanding, correct me if I'm wrong, that in Katlehong and confining ourselves to Mololeke section, we knew that one of the enemies of Mololeke would for instance be Inkatha, am I right?  That's the first?
And other people who would attack for reasons unknown, those would also be the enemies of Mololeke section is that not so?
According to the situation, anybody who attacked was regarded as an enemy.

So we have a number of possibilities and quite rightly the community says enough is enough.  What I want to find out from you that there wasn't one enemy - how did you come to a conclusion or decision by the community that you should go for the SDU and Blanko in this instance?

I think I explained in my evidence that even though they patrolled there would be some incidents the next day.  Now that is the reason why the community said enough was enough - because even during the threats the community was present, that is why the community took a decision.
Yes but you did not explain in your evidence in chief what led the community to say it is the SDU's, you did not say that, did you?
I can assure you I was listening attentively, you did not, hence I'm asking you that question.
My lord, just elaborate a little.
Mr Lekabe, my question is this simple.  I said to you there was an enemy in Mololeke section and then we would say the first enemy was Inkatha, remember I said that?
Now there were other people who committed criminal acts and they also were members - they were the enemies?

Now when you deliberated at this Sparza shop where you gathered, where the community said enough was enough, now to specifically go to SDU, what is it that was discussed about the SDU that led you to go straight to the SDU?

I explained Chairperson on Friday that on Sunday the 5th there was an altercation between myself and other members of the SDU.  We were fighting for sites in Mololeke.  I think the community did not get that right, they thought I was disturbing them in their duty of issuing out sides.  Now it was then decided that I should be eliminated before the end of the week.
Mr Lekabe, I tried in many ways to explain this question to you because we know, the first thing Buthelezi did not tell you who killed Bulelwa?
Yes that's correct he did not.
Now you met at this Sparza shop, you were forty to forty five according to your estimation, in other words, during that gathering you did not know as yet who killed Bulelwa?

Now you specifically identified members of the SDU to revenge, you said we now are attacking Blanko.  I want to know, when you deliberated, what is it that led you to take that decision of attacking the members of the SDU because you did not know as yet who killed Bulelwa?

My lord, I explained that the community said enough was enough and the allegations that members of the community, the leaders of the community, were supposed to be killed was already flying.  I think I explained that my lord.
Yes, my brother, I heard that one but you are not answering my question.
Maybe I do not understand your question.
This is my question shortly - You met at the Sparza shop, during that meeting you did not know who killed Bulelwa?
Now, you knew as members of the community that you had enemies such as Inkatha?
There were other enemies committing criminal activities in Mololeke?
Now you explain already that during the patrols by the SDU there would be things the next day despite the fact of patrolling?  Now let's put it this way - we now have three enemies?
Now among these three enemies, one should be responsible for the killing of Bulelwa?
Chairperson can I ask a question?

Now there are three enemies.  Now what led you to specifically say enough is enough and then you took a decision to go to this other enemy which is the SDU?  What is it that you discussed, what is it that you discussed that led you to taking the decision of attacking the SDU?

My lord, I'm explaining that Mololeke is a place that you would not commit a crime in Mololeke and then get away with it.  It was that simple.  Now the community decided that among members of the SDU the truth must come out. You would not commit an act in Mololeke whether during the day or during the night
but you would not get away with that.
Did the members of community suspect that Bulelwa had been killed by members of the SDU?
Were you present at the gathering where the community said enough is enough?
Can you recall what time that gathering was?
As I've explained Chairperson, I don't remember time because I spent much time to calm Mr Buthelezi, it might be before nine o'clock or after nine o'clock.
Was that gathering subsequent to the visit to you by Buthelezi?
We know that and I think you told us that you wanted to leave with Buthelezi but the person you were with said or at least advised against going?
At what time did you leave to go to the meeting?
I did not go Chairperson because Mr Buthelezi was calling me to Block F where Bulelwa's corpse was.
Buthelezi was calling you to Block F?

That is correct he was calling me to Block
F.
Were there people who had gathered at Block F?  Do you know, if you don't know say so?
I see you're shaking your head, either say no or yes.
Do you mean - are you asking that they met at Block F or Block C?
Buthelezi was calling you to Block F.  You didn't go there?
That is correct sir, I did not go to Block F.
Instead you went to Block C?
Mr Buthelezi called me from Block C where I was staying.  I did not go with him to Block F.
Where was this gathering of the Youth League and the community at which the community said enough is enough?
It was in Block C sir.
How did that gathering come about?
As I explained Chairperson, Buthelezi's scream and the blowing of the whistle, I think those are the two means for those people to meet.
Was the whistle blown from Block C?
I'm not sure from which direction of the community the blowing of the whistle came from.
We were told that if there is an attack or an incident which required the community, a whistle would be blown presumably from the spot where the community was required to come to, is that correct?
The body of Bulelwa was found in Block F is that right?
So the whistle in connection with her death would then have come from there, from Block F?
May you repeat your question sir?
The whistle relating to the death of Bulelwa would have come from Block F?
Did anything happen in Block C?
Just before the people gathered there.
Nothing happened on that day but I think people were attracted by Buthelezi's scream.
Buthelezi we do know do we not that he was at Block F where Bulelwa's body was?
Then why did people go to Block C?
As I explained Chairperson that maybe they were attracted by screaming, Mr Buthelezi, sir.
As I explained, maybe I was not understood that Mr Buthelezi came from Block F, he went to Block C to call me so that I should go to Block F.
What you're saying is that because of Buthelezi's scream when he was at Block C, the community might well have been attracted by that scream to come to Block C?
They would have disregarded the whistle which came from Block F?
So the whistle to them would have been meaningless?
As I've explained that they came to where they heard the scream.
Who had gathered at Block C?
As I explained Chairperson, that residents gathered there because with my observation they came from Block B and Block E and Block C.
As I recall it you said Blocks A, B and C.  Is that right?
Bulelwa resided in Block F did she not?
Is there any reason why members of the Block F community were not present there?
May you try to put rightly, do you mean at the spot where Bulelwa's corpse was or at the meeting?
I don't know the reason why they were not present sir.
Now did anyone address the meeting at Block C, the gathering at Block C?
The way it was Chairperson, is the residents gathered there because of Buthelezi's scream.  They asked me of saying "why do we hear the scream?"  That is why I addressed them.
I tried to calm down Mr Buthelezi first so that we'll be able to hear directly from him about the screaming.  That is when Mr Buthelezi, after he's been calmed down, he said Bulelwa has been killed.
The community - that Buthelezi had come to call you and that he had returned to Block F where Bulelwa's body was?
Mr Buthelezi left whilst residents were still gathered there from Block C back to Block F.
Was Buthelezi present when the community gathered at Block C?
As I explained that the - for some few minutes whilst he was there - yes the community has already gathered.
...[inaudible] was he still there?  When you gave the report to the community at Block C was Buthelezi still present at C or had he left for Block F?
Residents heard from Mr Buthelezi himself after he has calmed down by saying Bulelwa has been killed.
Why was it necessary for you again to explain to the community actually what had happened because Buthelezi from what you're telling us had already given that report.
There were some questions of what happened to Bulelwa exactly what happened in Mololeke, I think there were some questions.
Is there any reason why the community that had gathered at Block C did not proceed to the spot where Bulelwa's body had been found?
Do you mean from the meeting proceed to the spot or from that meeting back to their respective houses?

To the spot where Bulelwa's body was lying.  You see I get the impression that Buthelezi, after he had calmed down, explained to the people who had gathered at Block C that Bulelwa had been killed and he then left for Block F.  There were questions, you told us, which required you to answer them so what I'm asking is because you then knew that Bulelwa's body had been found at Block F and that is where you were likely to get the information as to what had happened.  Why did that community which had gathered there not proceed to Block F to where the body of Bulelwa's was lying?

Some of the residents of Block C, when they said to me I should not go there, it is because the previous week they saw members of the SDU's attacking me and Mr Mosala.  That is why they prevented me not to proceed to Block F because I was their target, if I appear there I would land in their hands.
The members of the community and the other members of the Youth League were gathered at C, why didn't they proceed to Block F?
What decision, if any, was taken at this gathering at Block C of and concerning the members of the SDU?

Residents said because of - they were emotionally charged - they said enough is enough.  They said we should apprehend these people firstly.  We should disarm them firstly because they are using those arms to harass the community.
You were going to apprehend member with the SDU and take them where?
Would apprehend them and take them to the community.
That's the community at that stage - you mean the community that had gathered at Block C?
As I explained that because of - the community was emotionally charged - within those members of the community, the directive came that enough is enough, that we should apprehend these people.
You say the decision was taken that you should go and apprehend these people and disarm them.  Now I want to find out where were you going to take these people to?
We would take them to the place where we usually hold our meetings which is KBA.
It is a place where residents of Mololeke used to hold their meetings.
Where about was it located in Mololeke, was it located in Mololeke section?
Yes it is within Mololeke section, it is in the centre of the Mololeke section.
It is at the beginning of Block D.

Did you - was any decision taken as to who was going to take part in the rounding up of the members of the SDU and disarming them or was everybody, both the Youth League members and members of the community, going to take part in this joint expedition?
The whole - all members who were present there, that is members of the community and members of the ANC Youth League will do that expedition.
And then did you then go in different directions and in different groups?
We now know that your group came across Oscar, Sonti and Rooivark?
I don't understand your information is when you say we met Oscar and Sonti?  Where, because when I explained on Friday I met them on Tuesday morning when they were looking for us.
Well maybe I didn't understand you.  From the meeting where did you go then, your group, where did it go?

You were at the meeting at Block C, where a decision had been taken that you were supposed to round up the members of the SDU, apprehend them and take them to KBA at the beginning of Block B.  Now from that gathering, where - and then you told us that you went in different groups to go and round up members of the SDU?
We went to Block D - Block E - that's where we went to Mr Blanko's place.  As I've explained that other members or other groups started at Vusi's place.
...[inaudible] group just proceed straight to Blanko's place - the group in which you were?
And did you tell Blanko that you wanted him to go and appear at KBA?
We explained to him that we're coming to fetch him because we are tired about their activities.  We requested him to go with us to KBA - that's where he resisted.
And then you started attacking him?
To your knowledge were any members of the SDU apprehended by the community or the Youth League and taken to KBA?
No Chairperson because they saw when we attacked Blanko, then they assembled.
Were you attacked - did members of the SDU come to Blanko's house at the same time that you were there?  Did they find you there?
When you left Blanko's place were the members SDU approaching Blanko's house?
I've no knowledge of that Chairperson.
By the time all of you left, the members of the SDU had not yet arrived at Blanko's place to your knowledge?
As I've already explained that I have no knowledge when did they arrive at Blanko's place.
There was no shootout at Blanko's place between your group and the SDU?
If I remember well Chairperson, we heard gun shots from us when we finished our work then that is where we went to the place where we stayed.
Did you run away from - when you left Blanko's place - were you walking or did you run away?
We were running, running away from the gunshots.
What was the cause of the conflict between the SDU and the Youth League?
Chairperson as I've already explained, the conflict started after we saw that members of the SDU's, their activities were not in accord with the community's interests.
Did you suspect that members of the SDU were involved in criminal activities?
You had been suspecting them of this for a long time, is that right?
But up until Bulelwa's death, no action was taken against them, right?
I said as a leader of the community within the Civic, I wrote a report which I was directing it to their leadership so that they should come and reprimand them for their activities.
You wrote the report to who?
I was writing that report to Central because I would take that report to a zonal meeting, then I had an assurance that that report has been taken through to the senior leadership.
No it did not help because they were once called by the Central to be reprimanded but they refused to meet the Central.
Yes, now, when Bulelwa was killed, it was then that the community and the Youth League members said enough is enough?
And the community and the Youth League members took Bulelwa's death as being part of the criminal activities of the SDU?
Okay and this led to the decision, the killing of Blanko.  This led to the killing of Blanko?
And this led to the retaliation by the SDU members on Youth League members?
And that's how the victims that were shot at the veld met their death?
They were killed because they had - they were suspected of having killed Blanko?
According to my knowledge that is how they were killed but according to the version of the members of the SDU they are not telling the truth.  That is not the truth they are telling here.
Thank you Mr Lekabe.  Mr Madasa are you going to be very long in your - do you have any question that you want to put to the witness?

Just one question ?  Okay, well perhaps we should break now for lunch and then what you can do in the meantime, would you take instructions from your Mr Armoed on what the witness had said and see whether there is anything that Mr Armoed would like to dispute?

If you would just take the opportunity for the lunch and adjournment to deal with that aspect.  The time is, it's quarter to two, we'll come back at quarter past two.
COMMITTEE ADJOURNS
ON RESUMPTION

Thank you Mr Chairperson.
	Mr Lekabe, as a member or a leader of the community I'm of the opinion perhaps you can shed some light on this question I'm going to ask you and I've got an impression that both members of the ANC Youth League and members of the SDU were ANC members, am I correct?
The SDU suspected the Youth League of having killed Bulelwa while the Youth League suspected the SDU - am I correct also?
I do not understand your question are you saying vice versa, the SDU was suspecting the Youth League, the Youth League were suspecting the - I think that's correct.

...[inaudible] also I think if you know you can say but if you don't know you are free to say that.  Oscar says they had an impression that there is some force which is pushing the youth, that's the words he used, he said there are some force whom we think are pushing the youth from behind and at the end under cross-examination he ended by saying "I think the third force was present here."  Now talking about the third force - what is your impression, do you think the third force was there or not?

Oscar is not telling the truth when he says the third force was involved because at the beginning of my evidence I mentioned that we patrolled together up to a point where we separated.  He is not telling the truth when he says the third force was involved.  I do not believe there was any third force involved at all.

One of two issues - Oscar also alleged that Mr Buthelezi played double standards, he would be seen with members of the Stability Unit and then sometimes he would be seen with members of the IFP and also that weapons which were used by the Youth League were among others the R1, the pistols used by the police and that at other stage they used to disarm the police.  Your brief reaction to that?
I know nothing of such weapons.
Has it been seen amongst the Stability Unit and the IFP?
That's a pure lie, I do not believe that Mr Buthelezi would be seen in both organisations - the Internal Stability Unit and the IFP.
Apart from their suspicions which were running around, up until today, no one knows who killed Bulelwa, am I correct?
I do not know, but the allegations put forward now is that the member of the SDU did the act - Oscar, Mthembu are the people who are implicated.
Mr Madasa do you have any questions?

Thank you Mr Chair.
	Did you say Armoed was armed with an AK-47 when they came to pick you up?
It did not work, I looked at him for the sole purpose of identifying him.  He had an AK-47 in his hand.  I took a thorough look at him.
Armoed denies that he was armed with an AK-47.  He says he was only given AK-47 at the shack when he was asked to guard the youth who had been apprehended.
It is surprising the way he puts his statement.  I explained already that himself and the other one called Movembi tried to shoot at me that time.
Now you said the community had mandated you or ordered you to run up SDU members and take them to KBA, remember saying that?
Now my question is, the community according to you had guarded at C, why were the SDU members going to be taken to KBA?
Where sir?  I want to follow your question thoroughly.
Well at the gathering which occurred at C Section.  It was decided that members of the SDU would be apprehended and then taken to KBA, is that right?
Well what counsel is putting to you is that people had gathered at Block C.  There was no one at KBA, why were members of the SDU to be taken to KBA where there would have been no one?
In my explanation I said we left with members of the community.  Now we were going to apprehend them and leave for KBA.
Now why did you not take Blanko by force?  According to you you were many when you went to his place - why did you not take him by force, tie him up?

I said this was a very quick meeting, we did not even take anything to tie him up with.  Can I carry on?  He resisted, he made noise.  Now we became aware that he was going to alert the others whom we also wanted.
Now you were told by the community to go to Blanko to apprehend him.  Was there a report back done to the community as to what transpired at Blanko?
At KBA yes or at C.  At KBA or at C was a report back done?
I said when we left Blanko's place it was a shoot out, we didn't manage to go to KBA.
Now, amongst other things you were supposed to do according to the community's order was to apprehend and disarm.  Did you bring any arms from Blanko's place?
I do not remember whether they were taken by those who were with me.
Now how many people shot Blanko?
We were three, I believe so because the others were armed with 9mm shots.
Who are the other two who fired at him?
The other one has since died, his name is Thabo.
I have just said that he had a shot gun.
The other one had a revolver.
You do not know the name of that one?
I do not remember his name, sir.
Was Thabo a Youth League member?
No, he was just a member of the community.
The other man, was he a Youth League member?
The one who had a revolver, was he an ANC Youth League member?
Chair I said he was one member of the community.

You said Thabo was a member of the community.  The one who had the 9mm and you said - listen - and you said the other one was an ANC Youth League member, now I'm asking whether the one who was an ANC Youth League member is the one who had the revolver?
The one who had a flywheel, you called it a flywheel, I think that's a revolver.  Was that the one who was an ANC Youth League member?
Thaba was a member of the ANC Youth League and the person who had a revolver was from the community, he was a member of the community.

Oh.  Thank you Mr Chair.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MADASA

Thank you Mr Lekabe you may return to your seat.
WITNESS EXCUSED
Thank you Mr Chair.  May I call Jabulani Mtwalo.
Did you reside at that place during December 1993?

Yes I used to reside at that place.
Is that zone 6?
We call Mololeke 6, we call it - we refer to it as 6 and when you would try to stop the taxi you put up a sign of 6.
Is that the same place where you resided in 1993?
Do you recall the incidents of 7th December 1993 which are the subject of this hearing?
Now on that day where were you?
I arrived on the 6th at Mololeke.  Often, times I would spend my time at my mother's place at Salumo.
Now on the following morning were you at that place?
Please repeat your question, which place?
I was at home the following day on the 7th.
Now were you approached by any persons on that day, at home?
I will explain it this way.  When myself and my friend were still sleeping - Amos - he's an Albino.

Amos is his name.  I don't know his surname.  We heard knocks at the door and Amos was awoken up and said I mustn't open the door and when I woke up I looked through the window and I saw a group of people outside wearing blankets.  I think there were about more than twenty in number if I'm not mistaken.  I heard them kicking the door, shouting open, open.  I opened the door in spite of what Amos was saying, insisting that we shouldn't open the door.   As I opened the door the first person who came in was Mr Ndabe but I did not know his surname at the time and when I was looking around, still around the same group, I saw Oscar as a person who I could identify and Armoed as well and Manzini.
I saw him - he was sitting right at the back.

I dressed up, I put on my pair of trousers.  As I was trying to look around for my T-shirt, I could not even locate and find my T-shirt because Mr Ndabe, the one who stormed in first in the house as I was asking him as to why people were just coming in, rushing in in the morning, coming to fetch me, where were they taking us?  He said I should not ask him anything.
He had a spear with him - he stabbed me with that spear on my arm, right hand arm.
Are you saying Mr Ndabe stabbed you with that spear on the arm?

I gathered that these people were there and in a spirit of war.  I could not even get an opportunity to find my T-shirt.  They instructed us that we should get out of the house, they were there to fetch us.
So did you get out of the house?
You see the shack had only two rooms.  It was only a bedroom and a kitchen.  I left Amos in the bedroom, I did not even explain to them that I was with Amos in the house.
So did they take you away?

Mr Ndabe proceeded through the bedroom where Amos was sleeping.  I think when he found Amos he woke him up - I don't know what happened subsequently whether he was assaulted or what because when I tried to ask Oscar as a person I knew as to what was happening, since I was lost and Oscar said I should not throw in questions to him and told others that this very one, his father is a Zulu and he reside in Zonge, Kobese is his name.
Okay.  How old were you at the time?
Sorry, just before that, were you a member of any political organisation in Mololeke?
Yes, I was a Youth League of ANC.
Okay, you were just saying you don't know what happened of Amos, then what did they do?

You see there were no fences or the fence around the yards of Mololeke shacks, Mr Ndabe was the one pushing me to go out of the shack and we exited at the back of the shack.  I saw Amos as well out following us as well - I was in the front.

The only word I heard was that Amos will be assaulted and Amos was assaulted by knopkierrie and they said an Albino cannot see at the night, the sight of an Albino at night is very poor - he can't even see anything and he was released.  He went back.
Now did they go along with you?
Yes they went along with me.  The one was, next to me, was Oscar and then Mr Ndabe.
And where to did they take you?
I was residing in Block D so we left Block D from Block F.
From Block F - We left Block D, we went to Block F.  Mr Ndabe was shouting as we're walking saying anyone who knows he is a dog patrolling he should come and see what that dogs have done.
You arrived at Block F and then what happened?
We met about six people who were keeping guard at Bulelwa's body that was lying there.
Did anyone respond to the call by Mr Sonti?
Was there any indication to you what is it that they were referring to as has been done by the dogs that were patrolling?
I did not know because I was at home sleeping.  They also took me from my house and I was at home sleeping.
Did they tell you what the dogs had done?
You mean them?  No they did not say anything to me.
Now what happened at Block F?  You said that you saw six people who were keeping guard at Bulelwa's corpse?
That is true.  When we arrived at the site they handed me over to some man, you know it's not even a man he's a youngster.
They said he should take me with to a shack and keep me there.
Were you taken to a shack?
Yes I was taken to a shack.
And when you arrived at the shack was there anyone?
Yes there were others.  When I arrived at the shack I found Mtabang already captured, I trying to recall the other - Jacob and Boetie.  Boetie is now deceased.
I don't know.  They were tied with a wire the three of them together on their feet and hands with a piece of wire.
The speaker's microphone is not on.
Yes they tied their hands at the back the three of them together and their feet as well, the same pattern.
When I arrived there, the one that was sent to take me to the shack had a piece a wire with and tied my feet and my hands at the back.

And they left us alone in the shack because they were all over the show outside and the members of the community had already gathered as well.  On that note, I asked the others who were already captured as to what is happening.  They said they were captured at about 4 a.m. they don't know as to what was happening, they were also lost and people were arriving and peeping through the windows and asking: 'hey, you boys, what have you done?'  I told them that I was fetched from my shack, I don't even know what was happening.
Were those people who were peeping through the door members of any organisation?
Those were just members of the community, ordinary members of the community.
Did anyone tell those people what you alleged to have done?
They would come in and ask and I will answer for myself and tell them I don't know.

I will request to say this, that even the person who tied me with wires is here in this hall.  It's the one I'm pointing at who is sitting right next to this one, right there where I'm pointing - the one who's even pointing at himself.
Yes.  He tied me with a wire.
Then were you joined by others in the shack?
Yes I think at about eleven if I'm not mistaken others joined.  The ones that I have clear recollection were Mele, Isaac and Didabe.
Were they also brought there by the same men who brought you in?

I did not see them as they arrived because they were not taken right inside the shack, they were only standing outside right by the door - we could see them from inside, they were not inside, that is them.
Stability arrived to fetch the bodies of the ones who were already killed.

We were kept in the shack.  I tried to untie this wire in an effort to escape and I managed to.  I also did untie the one on the feet and the other three cried to me that I should do the same with them and I was trying to untie the wires.  One woman stood by the door, came towards the door and said: 'here, the thugs are trying to escape.'  I don't know her [indistinct] I only know her from sight.  As I was trying to untie, they came back those men, they found that I was free and when they arrived they got inside the shack.  The one tried to hit me with an axe and it hacked right on the corrugated iron.  The axe hung on the corrugated iron - in other words he could not hit me.
Yes he is here.  That's the one, the one that I am pointing at with the white shirt.
The other one came with a rope.
Do you know which one came with a rope?
Yes did he tie you with the rope?

Yes when he arrived he said: 'this one is the one who is problematic he is trying even to escape, maybe we should tie him with this rope.'  They tied my hands and my feet and they tied the rope right on top.
Sir, when you say they tied top what are you referring to?
They tied my feet and this is how they tied my hands on top.
Did they tie you with...[indistinct] something onto the shack?
They tied my hands, first they tied my feet, secondly they tied my hands and they pulled the rope right to the top and this is what happened and this is how the position was.
I think we're more than 15 now - the boys - the ones who were captured.
They kept on bringing other youths into the shack?
Then when you were that number what happened?

We were taken out of the shack and they said maybe we should take them out of the shack and remove them because the Stability might find them there.  We were taken to the last shack in Block F right towards the veld, the last line in Block F.
Yes, you were in last shack in Block F, the next shack now - what happened?

They took us to that shack, it was still under construction it was not complete and they said we shall get inside and that's where we were kept.  After a while as we were still there, Mr Ntebe stomped in.
Is there anything Mr Ntebe said to you?
He threw a cigarette carton, Consulate.
Yes, he threw a cigarette carton and said?
And said please smoke because you are smoking for the last time today.
Now in that shack, were you asked any questions?

They were asking others, the ones that I was captured with and kept with and they were the ones who were responding to the questions, I never even answered back because I told them from the onset that I did not know a thing as they awoke me from a shack and I was sleeping.  I heard Mr Ndabe asking Mavuso the one we call Mavuso?  I said to Mavuso I said a long time ago Mavuso that one day they will capture you they will get hold of you and today is the day.
Didn't you ever say anything about Vips?
We just heard that Vips had already been killed, we heard from Mr Ndabe saying 'Hah we've already killed Vips.'
Who was he telling that they've killed Vips?  Was he telling you or the other men?
He was talking to these others and we heard as well - he was telling the members of his group - and we heard because we're in the same company.
Can you still recall who was in that group?
Yes and who else can you recall?
I don't remember the others because I was also dizzy because I was already stabbed as well so my body was a bit numb.  I was also losing it, I could not think straight.
One man from Salumi, Mr Koos, came in.
And he said to me 'are you also here?' and he went out immediately.  As we were still sitting there Armoed came in.

I was seated right towards the corner and Armoed called me and I stood up, I went to him.  As I was standing up, on that note, he asked others as to whether I was patrolling as well and they said no he wasn't there.
Asking the other persons who had been?

The other boys that were captured with, he was asking them.  He took me outside to the other group and three people were standing outside and other people were standing far away in groups and he took me to the ones that were there, the three of them.
And said to them:  'Comrades, this is my boy, he resides right next to my house in Block D.
Is there any one of the three amongst the applicants?

I don't remember now.  After he said what he said to them they said to me: 'Go' - you are free in other words.  As I tried to leave one of them called me.  I was naked, I had no T-shirt on top and the other one got hold of me with his nails right at the back and hit me with a fist.
Can you still remember who that one was?
And as I was leaving, trying to leave rather, they said to me:  'Hey you, boy, one word that will be said or uttered by you, you are dead meat.'
Did they say to you if you go and report what's happening here we're going to kill you?
They said that when they were releasing me.

That's how I was released.  I left the scene and when I arrived at home I found the place upside down, the whole place was just in disarray.  I had to go to hospital to be stitched where I was stabbed.  I could not even wash myself up due to the injury that I sustained.
Did you hear as to what happened with others who were in the shack, who were left in the shack?

As I was still home when I arrived my neighbour came and they were crying, screaming, asking as to what happened.  I told them that I left my fellow brothers in the shack there, that's where they're being kept - now I have a problem, you see I'm bleeding profusely now and I don't even have money to go to the hospital and the woman gave me R20, now the lady who is our neighbour gave me R20.
