Is that how you happened to go to the hospital?

Yes I got into a taxi and I left for the hospital.  When I came back from hospital, I never went back to 6, instead I went to my mom's home at Saluma.  At about 5 in the afternoon I met one boy who was residing at 6 - I don't quite remember his name.  He said to me all the boys that you've been captured with and were kept in the shack have been killed.
Thank you Mr Mtwalo, that's all Chairperson, thanks.

That's how I was saved in the whole ordeal.  Now the person who helped me in this was Armoed.  Had it not been for him I know I would have been killed today.  Now I do forgive Armoed and the one who stabbed me and wired me with I don't forgive them, I don't have any forgiveness for them.
Do you know the neighbour who gave you the sum of R20 to go to the hospital?

Yes, Mr Madasa?
CROSS-EXAMINATION BY MR MADASA

Thank you Mr Chair.
	Now when you were picked up at home was it dark in the shack?
It was in the morning about eight.
Sonti says you were mistaken, you were stabbed by - he says yes you were stabbed but by Holomisa - were you stabbed by Holomisa?
I was stabbed by Ntebe, I don't know Holomisa.
I know him very well because I marked his face.
Had you seen him for the first time on that particular day?
Had you seen Mr Ndabe as you call Mr Sonti - were you seeing him for the first time on the day when he came there and stabbed you?
I wasn't seeing him for the first time that day.
Or you were not that acquainted to him?
I knew him well see because he was also from 6, a resident of 6.
When you were stabbed what were you doing?
I was resisting to get out of the shack of home in other words, to get out of my home.
How many of them were inside when you were stabbed?
Two people came in and the others remained outside.  I was taken outside to them and then that's when we left.
When you were stabbed only two people were inside?
Do you know Holomisa that was referred to by [indistinct].
Maybe I know him from seeing him but I wouldn't claim I know him.
What is your answer, do you know Holomisa or don't you know him?
Do you know who was the other person who was inside with Ndabe when you were stabbed?
Is it not possible that when you were stabbed you did not see who was stabbing you but you thought it was Sonti?
No I saw him, he tried to stab me right on the chest and I retreated, that's how he stabbed me on the arm.
He tried to stab you on the chest and you avoided the blow with your right arm and you were stabbed?
And he stabbed me on my arm.
Did he say anything before he stabbed you?  Did Sonti say anything to you before he stabbed you?
Yes he said we are here to fetch you, to pick you up, let's go and I refused thus he stabbed me.
Now when you were at the shack, the first shack, are you saying people who wanted to ask you questions were able to do so?
No, no people came in to ask us questions.
In your evidence in chief, that people came in and asked what had happened?
People were asking:  'What have you done, boys?'
Yes that's how they were asking.
The thing is, people who wanted to ask you questions could do so?

If I'm not lying one man came in and I did not know him, he was a third man, he came holding a pistol.  When he was asking he would be kicking us at the same time and saying we should tell the truth to what we have done.
If they wanted to ask you questions, could they ask?
The lady who came in was Dumeleng's mom.
She said she was coming to talk or speak on behalf of her child and she was pushed outside.
Who said the criminals were trying to free themselves?
One woman who resided in Block F, I'm not even too sure, she came through - she peeped through that door and that's what she said.
Now, you said, Rodrick Singo, number 8, tried to attack you with an axe but the axe landed on the - in the sink or corrugated iron.  Was he not scaring you?
I wouldn't know but I thought that he was stabbing, it just hung on the corrugated iron.  What if it got free?
I mean what if he wanted to chop you, he could have chopped you?
But Mr Madasa, what the witness is saying that is that he wanted to but the axe got stuck in the corrugated iron.
Thank you Mr Chair.  I'm saying, Mr Chair, if Singo, Mr Singo wanted to chop you he could have pulled the axe and chopped you.  Is that so?

It got stuck there and he also took it so he still had it on his hand, it never got stuck there forever.  He pulled it, it got stuck on the corrugated iron and he took it back.  He was trying to chop me this way and that's what happened but he still had it on his hand.  He didn't try to chop me after that.
Now when you were inside the shack were your friends asked questions about Blanko or Bulelwa's death?
No but what I know is what I heard from Mr Manzini.  He was saying something to this effect that we are following Blanko today.
Were there any accusations directed at you or your friends?
Were you or your friends accused of having done something?
From what I think, maybe it was due to Blanko's death.
But did - I think what counsel wants to find out from you is - did anyone make any accusations against any one of you in the shack?

As I said only this man who had a pistol in his hand and came in and kept kicking us and others were crying.  Because I did not know, I was quiet, I wasn't being asked a lot but they were asking the others and they would cry as they were being asked.
They were told to tell the truth.  Were you told what truth you've got to tell?
Yes this man came in and we were tied with this wire.  He said we must tell the truth and, no I don't remember.
Were you told what was the problem, why you were kept there?
No I did not hear anything to that effect.
Sorry, may I just ask here, were you never told that they wanted the truth about Blanko's death?
The thing is I don't know Thokozani Buthelezi.
Did your friends accuse each other of having done something or having been asked to do something?
No I was only asked by them as to what has hurt me and I told them that the SDU man came in and I was injured then that was the only thing they asked me since they saw me bleeding.
No, that your friends accused each other of some involvement but you did not hear because you were in pain?
Yes I was a bit dizzy now I could not concentrate and I could not hear.
Is it possible that they said certain things which you did not hear because you were in pain?
That your other friends said certain things which you did not hear because you were in pain?

I saw this boy by the name of Dumaleng, he is the one who was busy pointing at Mavuso, I don't know as to what they were arguing about because the other one said you are the one and other one say that back.

The counsel is asking you this question, as you were in pain having sustained injury and beginning to be dizzy according to your version and not concentrating much to what others were discussing or what was being discussed at the time, it could happen or it is possible or could it be possible that some of the boys might have said something that you missed?

I heard when we were in the last shack when they were pointing at each other that is is Dumaleng and Mavuso and Dumaleng was pointing at Mavuso saying you are the one and Mavuso would do the same and deny and say I'm not the one.  That's the argument I heard.

He's not asking you about things you heard or did not hear, what he's asking is, could it be possible, since you were dizzy were there some things that were happening there in the shack that you could not see them?
I did not see anything, we were sitting down on the floor.
Did you hear what Mavuso and Dumaleng were accusing each other about?
They were accusing each other about fetching each other at night.  The other one was saying you are the one who came at night and that is what they were arguing about or accusing each other about.
...[inaudible] Dondolo, do you know him very well?
Do you know that he was a commander?
Yes I do know that he was a commander of the SDU but I don't have confirmation of this.
Did you hear him when he gave an order that he should be killed?

I heard him say here's a cigarette, smoke for the last time today and he threw it on the floor where we're sitting and he left and that's what he said: 'smoke for the last time today.'  The only word I heard was from Mr Manzini saying you are following Blanko today.
Was the carton sealed, the carton of cigarettes?

I have no further questions, Mr Chair.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MADASA
I've got no questions Mr Chairperson.

Thank you Chairperson.
Mr Mtwalo, do you know this practice that when something has happened a whistle would be blown?
And if we look at Block D, is it far from Block C?

It will be Block D and the next will be - the first one is A and B is next then C follows and there will be a tar road
and then Block D.
If a whistle were to be blown in Block C, would you hear that whistle?
No, I did not hear a thing, I was sleeping, I only heard gunshots at night when we're sleeping.
The question is, if you hear a whistle being - if a whistle were to be blown from Block C, would you hear it in Block D, that's my question.
No, I did not hear it.
What I'm asking you, say Mr Mtwalo, is that when a whistle is being blown in Block C and you're residing in Block D would you hear it?
And you say on this particular night you heard nothing?
No I did not hear a thing.
When you were taken to the shack it was at Block F, that is the first shack isn't it so?
Did you see a body and now we know it was Bulelwa's, did you see a body lying down and being guarded at Block F?
Yes, I saw it, we passed by it because the shack was not far away from where the body was lying.
Did anybody or anyone tell you whose body that was?
No one said a thing to me with that regard.
Did you ask anybody even your co-captured people in the shack?

What I asked them was:  'What's happening, why you're captured here because now I've been stabbed, it looks like we're sailing the same boat and what is the problem?' and they said we've been captured at about 4 a.m. we don't know why.
Now when you returned to your shack at D, did you find Amos?
Amos had fled, I understand he came back, he took his possessions or his clothes because he had a few pair of trousers at home, he took his clothes, he did not even bid anyone farewell, he just left.
Thank you Chairperson, I've got no further questions.
Do you know Mr Armoed's children?
Did you used to play with them?
Yes we used to play with his children.

Mr Chair it's not strictly arising from the
questions from Mr Chair but just one question which I left out.
When you were released did you gain the impression that you were released because you nothing to do with the allegations that were levelled at your friends?
I was released purely on the grounds that I had done nothing.
Just one question Chairperson.   Weren't you saying you were released by Mr Armoed because he knows you?
Didn't you say you were released by Mr Armoed because Mr Armoed knows you, you are staying nearby his place?
Yes, released me because he knew me since his house is opposite our house.
Thank you Mr Mtwalo, you may stand down.

Thank you Chair, I feel like making a request for a short adjournment just to consult with the members of the family on a particular aspect.  Unfortunately Chairperson I couldn't get enough opportunity to ...[inaudible] with that particular one.  I don't think will be too long.
How much time do you need?
I think I need about 5 - 10 minutes Chairperson.
How many witnesses do you still have to call?
I intend calling only one Chairperson if I get instructions from the family.
Ten minutes will take us to ten to four and we intend rising at four o'clock so I doubt whether there is anything we can do in about ten minutes.
Okay, we are of the view that perhaps we should rise for the day if - in that time.
Yes Chairperson, I would be comfortable with that.

Sorry Mr Chair, I have a request to make.  I did not do this during the time my case was open because I wasn't sure whether this person was relevant to my case but there is one family member of the victims, a mother of one of the victims, whom I've spoken to, whom I intend calling to Mr Chair's permission to give short evidence in regard to her feelings about her son's death and forgiveness in regard to the applicants.  I'm therefore asking permission from Mr Chair if could permit me to call that witness tomorrow - very short evidence.

Is that witness going to give evidence often concerning the issues before us mainly whether or not there's full disclosure or there was any political motivation or it's going to be significant to give evidence that's strictly relevant to the issues before us?

Mr Chair, that is why I'm making this request because I know that her evidence is not relevant to those issues, however, it may be evident when one takes the whole case in totality as to her preparedness to forgive the applicants.

Very well, discuss the matter with Mr Mapoma and see whether you can reach any accruement in that regard otherwise, speaking for myself, I do not think there is any problem if she wants to testify.  Very well, would you discuss the matter, nature of the evidence with Mr Mapoma and then would you let us know tomorrow morning at quarter to nine what accruement if any you have reached otherwise we don't have any difficulty with that evidence.  Okay the Committee will now rise, we'll reconvene tomorrow morning at nine o'clock.  Mr Madasa and Mr Mapoma would you please make sure that those officers, whether it's the Department of Correctional Services or whether it's the Department of the South African Police Services who are having custody of Michael Armoed - ensure that he is brought here at least by half past eight tomorrow morning so that we do not have the situation which arose this morning where we have to commence without the applicant being present, a situation which I must confess I find highly undesirable because I believe that somebody has not done his duty somewhere.   Would you make sure that Michael Armoed is brought here by 8.30 tomorrow morning?

Will you all rise and we'll reconvene at 9 o'clock tomorrow morning.
COMMITTEE ADJOURNS
